jobs.title: Software Development Engineer (Multiple Positions Available)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.


About the Team & Role 

Are you ready to build the future of supply chain technology and solve some of the most challenging technical problems out there? At Auger, we’re looking for passionate Software Development Engineers who are eager to design and develop innovative solutions at-scale. This is your chance to work on cutting-edge projects that blend data, AI, and real-time systems to transform global supply chains. As an SDE at Auger, you’ll work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry, learning and contributing to mission-critical systems. Whether you’re designing APIs, optimizing data flows, or implementing new features, your work will have a direct and meaningful impact on businesses worldwide. We’re not just looking for coders; we’re looking for builders—creative problem-solvers who thrive on tackling complex challenges. This is a chance to grow, learn, and make your mark on a product that’s reshaping an industry. 

Key Responsibilities

Building Awesome Features 
- Design and develop software components that power Auger’s cutting-edge supply chain solutions. 
- Work on real-time data pipelines, APIs, or AI-powered tools to deliver innovative features for our customers.

Tackling Real-World Problems 
- Solve complex technical challenges in scalability, performance, and data integration. 
- Dive into tough problems, like optimizing logistics algorithms or improving the responsiveness of our platform. 

Collaborating with the Best
- Work closely with experienced engineers, data scientists, and product managers to deliver seamless and impactful solutions. 
- Share ideas, ask questions, and learn from teammates who are excited to help you grow.

Learning and Innovating Daily 
- Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies and best practices in cloud computing, AI, and software development. 
- Take on ownership of your projects, knowing your code will power real-world applications used by global businesses. 

Making an Impact 
- Be part of a team that’s revolutionizing how global supply chains work. 
- See your contributions go live and make a difference in the world of logistics and beyond. 
 

Qualifications 

We want team members who are ready and willing to take on a variety of challenges and bring an abiding curiosity about the “what’s” and “why’s” of the data and technology. You’ll thrive if you’re a resilient, driven, and confident, developer who brings the determination to tackle one of the most complex and consequential challenges in the world. Specific qualifications we are looking for: 

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience, with expertise in Java or Python.

  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP. 

  • Understanding of algorithms, data structures, and distributed systems. 

  • Prior experience building scalable SaaS platforms or enterprise applications. 

  • Ability to work in-person from our Bellevue Headquarters  

  • Ability to work on-call rotations 

  • Ability to work collaboratively through ambiguity, with urgency, patience, and good humor 


Bonus Points & Other Considerations

  • Knowledge of supply chain systems or logistics is a plus. 

  • Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks and techniques (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch). 

  • Familiarity with databases (SQL or NoSQL) or real-time data streaming platforms (Kafka, Flink). 

  • Experience tinkering with side projects, open-source contributions, or anything that shows you love to build and learn. 

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Supply Chain Intelligence Engineer (Multiple Positions & Levels)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

About the Team & Role


The Forward Deployed Data Team at Auger is on a mission to revolutionize how global supply chain information is accessed, indexed, and advanced. Supply chain data is vast and messy, but it’s also the fuel that powers efficiency, sustainability, and innovation. Our team is developing analytical approaches that turn this raw, complex data into actionable intelligence, enabling smarter decisions and better outcomes for everyone.

Variety, quality, timeliness, and completeness—this is the lifeblood of our work. If you’re a curious, result-oriented Supply Chain Intelligence Engineer who thrives on solving hard problems, exploring new platforms, and building something the world has never seen before, we want you on our team.


What You’ll Do

  • Build and scale data models, dashboards, and visualizations that reveal patterns, trends, and actionable insights across global supply chains.

  • Partner with applied scientists, data engineers, and product teams to design analytic frameworks that surface the right metrics at the right time.

  • Translate complex data from Auger’s agentic and semantic systems into clear, compelling narratives for business and technical stakeholders.

  • Identify opportunities for predictive and prescriptive analytics, helping teams anticipate issues before they arise.

  • Drive data governance, KPI consistency, and metric definitions that enable reliable, repeatable insight generation.

  • Own end-to-end delivery of BI solutions—from data extraction and transformation to visualization and executive presentation.

What You’ll Bring

1. Data Analytics & Visualization Expertise

  • Proven experience designing and developing BI dashboards and visualizations using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker (Power BI preferred in Azure environments).

  • Strong SQL skills and comfort working with large, complex datasets.

  • Deep understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas) and best practices for analytic scalability.

2. Supply Chain & Business Acumen

  • Strong grasp of supply chain operations, logistics, inventory, and fulfillment metrics.

  • Ability to translate operational complexity into clear metrics and visualizations that drive decision-making.

  • Experience defining KPIs for network efficiency, cost optimization, lead times, and service reliability.

3. Data Storytelling & Insight Generation

  • Ability to synthesize analytics into business recommendations, including root-cause analysis and scenario simulation.

  • Experience working cross-functionally to design executive-ready dashboards that blend clarity with strategic depth.

  • Familiarity with modern BI patterns—semantic models, interactive filtering, and drill-through analytics.

4. Collaboration & Systems Thinking

  • Comfortable partnering with data engineers and applied scientists to connect insights to the broader data and AI ecosystem.

  • Experience aligning analytic products with LLM-powered or agentic workflows, helping bridge raw data to intelligent automation.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.


About the Team & Role

The Forward Deployed Data Team at Auger is on a mission to revolutionize how global supply chain information is accessed, indexed, and advanced. Supply chain data is vast and messy, but it’s also the fuel that powers efficiency, sustainability, and innovation. Our team is developing analytical approaches that turn this raw, complex data into actionable intelligence, enabling smarter decisions and better outcomes for everyone.

Variety, quality, timeliness, and completeness—this is the lifeblood of our work. If you’re a passionate engineer and developer who thrives on solving hard problems, exploring new platforms, and building something the world has never seen before, we want you on our team.

As a Sr. Data Engineer, you will leverage new and existing data sources in support of Auger’s core data lake and injestion of customer data into our platform.  We're seeking teammates who love data of all kinds, are masters of building efficient, scalable, operable data pipelines, and are ready to take hands-on coding ownership in the following areas:

  • Data ingestion pipelines for existing and new data sources (both batch and real-time streaming)

  • Experience with all forms of multi-modal data types

  • Monitoring frameworks to protect data quality and consistency

  • Data modeling design and data architecture skills to support reporting and analytics requirements

  • Experience in the latest generation of data lake architectures, stream and batch processing, and managed cloud services to support scale.

Qualifications

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other data-intensive discipline with substantive engineering experience.

  • 5+ years demonstrated development experience using SQL, Scala, Spark, Flink, Beam, and/or Python

  • 5+ years demonstrated experience in data management (structured and unstructured) and modern database technologies

  • Demonstrated experience developing data pipelines to support machine learning, LLMs or other analytical solutions

  • Experience working with multi-cloud providers such as AWS and Azure

  • Work and collaborate in-person at our Bellevue Headquarters

  • Ability to work collaboratively through ambiguity, with urgency, patience, and good humor

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Customer Solutions Architect
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

About the Role

As a Solutions Architect at Auger, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping how enterprise customers leverage AI to transform their supply chains.

You’ll partner directly with customers, executive leadership, and product teams to design intelligent, scalable solutions built on Auger’s platform. You’ll lead workshops, discovery sessions, and strategy meetings to uncover deep operational needs—and turn them into architectures that deliver measurable results.

This is a hands-on, high-impact role for someone who thrives at the intersection of business context, supply chain operations, technical design, and real-world delivery. Expect to travel to client sites for collaboration, solution validation, and executive presentations.


What You’ll Do

  • Lead customer workshops and discovery sessions, gathering requirements and ensuring alignment across executive and operational stakeholders.

  • Design and document end-to-end solution architectures, mapping Auger’s products and AI capabilities to complex customer environments.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with the Engineering, Product, and Supply Chain Scientists to shape and refine solution strategies.

  • Provide ongoing leadership during implementation, ensuring architectures remain scalable, secure, and aligned with customer objectives.

  • Stay ahead of emerging trends in AI, decision intelligence, and supply chain management—and translate those insights into actionable recommendations.

What You’ll Bring

  • 7+ years of experience in solution architecture, technical consulting, or enterprise systems integration, ideally in supply chain, logistics, or manufacturing.

  • Strong understanding of AI, analytics, and cloud-based architectures.

  • Proven ability to translate business challenges into technical solutions that deliver measurable value.

  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills; comfortable presenting to both executives and technical audiences.

  • Experience leading client workshops and stakeholder engagements.

  • Background in data integration, APIs, or enterprise platforms (ERP, WMS, TMS, MES, or similar).

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Sr. UX Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

 About the Role 

As a Senior UX Designer at Auger, you’ll design intuitive, elegant, and high-performance experiences that power our customer-facing applications. You’ll translate technical complexity into flows and interactions that feel seamless and delightful.

At Auger, designs don’t collect dust—we ship what you create. We’re looking for a designer who can work quickly, maintain an extremely high quality bar, and thrive in a fast-moving environment.

 

Key Responsibilities 

  • Interface Design: Deliver polished, consumer-grade interfaces for complex workflows in Auger’s SaaS platform.

  • Design Systems: Evolve and scale our design system to enable speed and consistency.

  • Collaboration: Work closely with PMs, engineers, and other designers to rapidly move designs into production.

  • User Research: Test and validate ideas with customers, using insights to refine workflows.

  • High Standards: Ensure every pixel and interaction meets a best-in-class quality bar.

 

Qualifications 

  • 5–8 years of UX/UI design experience with SaaS or complex web platforms.

  • Portfolio showcasing high-quality design executed at speed.

  • Fluency with tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD.

  • Strong grasp of user-centered design, information architecture, and scalable systems.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.

  • Comfortable designing in a fast-moving startup where speed-to-build is as important as polish.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

About the Team & Role

We’re looking for a Front-End Engineer who’s excited to build intuitive, high-performance interfaces that power real-time supply chain decisions. You’ll collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers to bring complex systems to life in a simple, user-friendly way.

From building data-rich dashboards to optimizing performance at scale, your work will directly impact the way our customers interact with and derive value from our platform.

Key Responsibilities

Building Beautiful, Performant UI
- Design and develop software components and facing features that power Auger’s cutting-edge supply chain solutions.
- Work on real-time data pipelines, APIs, or AI-powered tools to deliver innovative features for our customers.

Tackling Real-World Problems
- Build and optimize front-end performance for large scale data interactions.
- Design systems that are resilient, accessible, and scalable.

Collaborating with the Best
- Work closely with engineers, designers, and product managers to deliver seamless and impactful solutions.
- Share ideas, ask questions, and learn from teammates who are excited to help you grow.

Learning and Innovating Daily
- Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies and best practices in cloud computing, AI, and software development.
- Take on ownership of your projects, knowing your code will power real-world applications used by global businesses.

Qualifications

We want team members who are ready and willing to take on a variety of challenges and bring an abiding curiosity about the “what’s” and “why’s” of the data and technology. You’ll thrive if you’re a resilient, driven, and confident, developer who brings the determination to tackle one of the most complex and consequential challenges in the world. Specific qualifications we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

  • 2+ years of professional software development experience, with expertise in TypeScript or JavaScript.

  • Hands-on experience with Front-End frameworks like React.

  • Solid understanding of core front-end concepts-component architecture, state management, performance tuning, etc.

  • Familiarity with data visualization and API integrations.

  • Prior experience building scalable SaaS platforms or enterprise applications.

  • Ability to work in-person from our Bellevue Headquarters.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Director of Strategic Partnerships
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

Role Overview

Auger is seeking a strategic, technically fluent business development leader to build and expand our ecosystem of technology partnerships. As Director of Strategic Partnerships, you will be responsible for identifying, negotiating, and managing relationships that extend Auger’s platform capabilities, open new go-to-market channels, and strengthen our position in the supply chain technology landscape.You’ll work across the organization — with leaders in Product, Engineering, Customer Engagement, and Finance — to align partnership initiatives with business objectives, drive joint value creation, and ensure partnerships deliver measurable commercial impact.

A major early focus will include deepening Auger’s collaboration with leading cloud providers and their partner programs — including co-sell, marketplace, and funding initiatives — but your charter extends far beyond any single relationship. You’ll also scout and structure new technology and commercial alliances that enhance Auger’s competitive advantage and support our growth strategy.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute Auger’s partnership strategy, identifying opportunities that strengthen our product, data, and go-to-market ecosystem.

  • Evaluate, negotiate, and operationalize partnerships across technology, data, and strategic business domains, ensuring mutual value creation.

  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering to integrate partner capabilities — from data sources to cloud technologies — that enhance our solution suite.

  • Work with Customer Engagement and Marketing to develop joint go-to-market motions, co-marketing initiatives, and revenue-sharing programs with key partners.

  • Manage high-value strategic relationships, including global cloud alliances, ensuring strong visibility and priority within partner ecosystems.

  • Identify and secure partnership funding opportunities (e.g., joint investment, co-sell credits, or ecosystem incentive programs) to fuel growth.

  • Collaborate with Finance and Legal to structure agreements that balance commercial opportunity with compliance and scalability.

  • Monitor and measure partnership impact, reporting on KPIs such as influenced pipeline, revenue contribution, and joint program ROI.

  • Stay attuned to the evolving supply chain technology ecosystem, spotting emerging platforms, data providers, and integration opportunities.

  • Represent Auger externally with strategic partners, at industry events, and in ecosystem forums to elevate the company’s presence and influence.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or related field; MBA preferred.

  • 8+ years of experience in partnerships, business development, or ecosystem strategy, ideally within SaaS, AI, or enterprise technology sectors.

  • Proven success identifying, structuring, and managing complex strategic partnerships with measurable commercial outcomes.

  • Strong understanding of cloud, data, and analytics ecosystems and how partnerships can drive joint value creation.

  • Excellent negotiation and relationship management skills, with the ability to influence both internal and external senior stakeholders.

  • Financial and strategic fluency — able to assess business cases, forecast impact, and align partnerships with company goals.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience building partnerships with major cloud or technology platforms, including joint GTM or funding programs.

  • Familiarity with data partnerships, API integrations, or marketplace ecosystems.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Head of Accounting
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

About the Role

As Head of Accounting at Auger, you will be responsible for owning and leading all aspects of the company’s accounting function. Reporting directly to the CFO, you will ensure the integrity of financial reporting, compliance with GAAP, and the efficient operation of accounting processes across the organization.

This is both a strategic and hands-on leadership role—ideal for someone eager to build the function, establish scalable processes, and lead a growing team supporting a high-growth, global business. You will oversee the full accounting lifecycle, including revenue recognition, financial reporting, audits, tax, payroll, compliance, and systems implementation and integration. You’ll play a key role in supporting executive decision-making and preparing Auger for future growth and potential public readiness.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead and scale the accounting function — establish the team structure, hire key personnel, and develop internal and external (agency) resources to support Auger’s rapid growth.

  • Own all accounting operations, including general ledger, accounts payable/receivable, payroll, revenue recognition, consolidations, and tax compliance.

  • Drive accurate revenue recognition and contract accounting, ensuring compliance with ASC 606 and alignment with multi-year, milestone-based, or usage-based contracts.

  • Partner closely with FP&A and the CFO to ensure accurate revenue tracking, margin analysis, and financial forecasting. Provide visibility into revenue streams, contract timing, and deferred revenue impacts to support data-driven planning and reporting.

  • Ensure accurate, GAAP-compliant financial reporting and maintain robust internal controls to support audit readiness and investor transparency.

  • Manage external relationships with auditors, tax advisors, and payroll providers, ensuring timely and high-quality deliverables.

  • Oversee month-end and year-end close processes, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of financial results.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales Operations, Legal, People, and Business Operations to align accounting practices with business activities and ensure compliance.

  • Drive process automation and system improvements, identifying opportunities to streamline accounting workflows and leverage technology for scale.

  • Support strategic financial initiatives, including contract structuring, international expansion, and M&A readiness.

  • Prepare the company for future audits and financial milestones, including potential public company requirements.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field; CPA strongly preferred.

  • 10+ years of progressive accounting experience, including leadership of accounting teams in high-growth environments.

  • Deep expertise in U.S. GAAP, financial reporting, audits, revenue recognition (ASC 606), tax compliance, and payroll operations.

  • Experience managing audits and working with external auditors and consultants.

  • Proven ability to build and lead teams, implement scalable processes, and manage change effectively.

  • Strong systems orientation—experience with modern accounting and ERP software (e.g., NetSuite, Intacct, QuickBooks Enterprise, etc) and data integration tools.

  • Exceptional attention to detail, analytical skills, and accountability.

  • Hands-on and proactive approach—willing to roll up sleeves while building for scale.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

jobs.descriptionHtml:

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

Role Overview

As Head of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) at Auger, you will be the strategic finance leader driving visibility, insight, and performance across the company. Reporting directly to the CFO, you will own all planning, forecasting, and business analytics activities, helping to translate Auger’s growth strategy into actionable financial plans.

You’ll partner closely with executive leadership and department heads to define pricing and business models, optimize margins, and forecast growth with precision. You’ll also play a critical role in supporting fundraising and investor communications, developing the financial narratives and analyses that enable Auger’s next phase of expansion.

This is a high-impact, hands-on leadership role for someone who thrives in dynamic, scaling environments and can operate effectively from boardroom strategy to detailed financial modeling.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the FP&A function, building scalable processes, tools, and a high-performing team to support a rapidly growing business.

  • Own company-wide forecasting, budgeting, and long-range planning, ensuring alignment between strategy, execution, and financial outcomes.

  • Drive pricing and business model strategy, partnering with Product, Sales, and the CFO to refine monetization approaches, evaluate new revenue streams, and optimize unit economics.

  • Partner with the CFO and executive team on capital strategy, scenario planning, and board-level financial materials.

  • Support fundraising activities, including financial modeling, investor presentations, and due diligence for equity and debt financing.

  • Develop and maintain dynamic financial models that reflect current performance, future growth drivers, and key business sensitivities.

  • Collaborate with Accounting to ensure accurate revenue recognition, expense tracking, and variance analysis.

  • Provide strategic decision support to functional leaders (Sales, Product, Operations, People) through analysis of performance metrics, ROI, and resource allocation.

  • Build dashboards and reporting frameworks to monitor key financial and operational KPIs across the company.

  • Establish scalable forecasting and reporting systems, leveraging automation and business intelligence tools.

  • Contribute to executive storytelling, helping articulate Auger’s business model, unit economics, and financial trajectory to investors and the board.

  • Play a hands-on role in key strategic initiatives, including pricing architecture, margin optimization, and global expansion.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or related field; MBA or CFA preferred.

  • 8+ years of progressive experience in FP&A, corporate finance, or investment banking — ideally with time in high-growth technology or SaaS environments.

  • Demonstrated expertise in pricing strategy, business model development, and financial scalability for technology-driven or SaaS businesses.

  • Strong command of financial modeling, forecasting, and scenario analysis, with a focus on scalability and accuracy.

  • Proven experience supporting fundraising or investor relations, including preparation of data rooms, pitch materials, and financial narratives.

  • Deep understanding of SaaS and enterprise contract metrics, including ARR, NRR, LTV/CAC, gross margin, and revenue recognition.

  • Advanced proficiency in Excel and with FP&A and BI tools

  • Highly analytical and detail-oriented, with a proactive, problem-solving mindset.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in venture-backed or private-equity-backed companies at the Series A–C stage.

  • Exposure to board-level reporting, fundraising processes, and investor management.

  • Experience modeling contract-based or usage-based revenue and evaluating pricing elasticity.

  • Familiarity with international growth and multi-entity forecasting.

  • Prior partnership with Accounting on GAAP reporting and ASC 606 alignment.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

About the Team & Role 

As a Senior Software Development Engineer at Auger, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and scaling key components of our operating system architecture, which powers next-generation supply chain solutions. Your contributions will enable real-time insights, AI-driven optimizations, and seamless automation, fundamentally transforming how global logistics operate.

This is a hands-on technical leadership role, where your responsibilities will go beyond coding. You will mentor and guide junior engineers, make impactful architectural decisions, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to tackle the most challenging supply chain problems. You will work on a mix of core systems, scalable APIs, and AI integrations, delivering software that directly impacts businesses across the globe.

Key Responsibilities

AI-Driven Product Development

  • Design and maintain scalable software for Auger’s platform, optimizing AI models and data pipelines to improve supply chain forecasting, planning, and management.

  • Collaborate with AI scientists to integrate machine learning solutions into real-time, customer-facing applications.

Platform Engineering

  • Architect and implement secure, high-performing systems capable of processing large-scale, real-time logistics data.

  • Build and scale RESTful and GraphQL APIs to support the seamless integration of applications and services across the platform.

  • Develop fault-tolerant, cloud-native microservices that prioritize performance and maintainability.

Architectural Influence

  • Contribute to system-wide architectural decisions to ensure scalability, reliability, and long-term performance.

  • Design solutions that integrate data processing, semantic intelligence, and AI workflows into the broader operating system.

Mentorship and Collaboration

  • Mentor junior and mid-level engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning, collaboration, and high-quality code.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams, including product managers and DevOps engineers, to ensure technical initiatives align with business objectives.


Qualifications

  • 8+ years of professional software development experience, including a proven track record of designing and scaling complex systems.

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

  • Strong hands-on coding skills in Python, Java, or C++ and a deep understanding of software engineering best practices.

  • Demonstrated expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and building scalable, distributed systems.

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and modern system architecture patterns.

  • Prior experience building and maintaining SaaS platforms or enterprise-grade applications.

  • Proven ability to mentor and guide engineers, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team environment.

  • Experience contributing to architectural decisions and influencing system-wide technical direction.

  • Ability to work in a cross-functional environment, collaborating with data engineers, AI scientists, and DevOps teams to deliver holistic solutions.

  • Comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving high-impact technical challenges with creativity and rigor.

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Applied Scientist - AI & Semantic Intelligence
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join Auger — Where Innovation Meets Real-World Impact

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.

What We’re Building

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.

Why It Matters

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.

About the Position


Auger's AI & Semantic Intelligence Team is at the heart of this transformation—developing intelligent, context-aware systems that reason, learn, and act autonomously to improve global supply chains. We are seeking a curious and results-oriented Applied Scientist who is passionate about building the next generation of AI systems at scale. We have more ideas than time to implement, so the proven ability and passion to rapidly prototype and validate concepts is the most important skill for this role.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and scale semantic architectures that model complex relationships across massive, multi-modal data ecosystems.

  • Develop LLM-powered reasoning and retrieval pipelines, integrating RAG, semantic embeddings, and agentic decision-making capabilities.

  • Build and optimize vector-based search systems for high-dimensional semantic retrieval using ANN algorithms.

  • Lead research and experimentation on graph learning, representation learning, and large-scale NLP, with an emphasis on production-grade deployment.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with data, ML, and engineering teams to ship intelligent systems that power Auger’s agentic platform.

What You’ll Bring

1. Semantic Graph & Knowledge Graph Mastery

  • Deep experience designing and scaling semantic/knowledge graphs for complex domains.

  • Hands-on proficiency with Neo4j, ArangoDB, or Amazon Neptune and frameworks like DGL, PyTorch Geometric, or NetworkX.

  • Advanced skills in ontology design and entity disambiguation.

2. NLP, Generative AI & Embeddings

  • Mastery of NLP techniques for entity/relation extraction, summarization, and semantic understanding using transformer models (BERT, GPT, T5).

  • Expertise in embedding generation (Sentence-BERT, OpenAI embeddings, or domain-specific models).

  • Experience integrating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) or LLM orchestration into semantic pipelines.

3. Vector Databases & Scalable Search

  • Proficiency with Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus, or FAISS for vector search and retrieval.

  • Strong understanding of Approximate Nearest Neighbor (ANN) algorithms and real-time semantic indexing.

4. Advanced AI/ML for Semantic Systems

  • Experience with Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architectures, contrastive learning, and few/zero-shot learning.

  • Knowledge of multimodal AI—integrating text, images, and structured data into unified graph representations.

5. Research & Experimentation

  • Proven ability to conduct original research in NLP, semantic understanding, or graph learning (publications preferred).

  • Expertise in evaluation metrics for semantic systems: precision, recall, similarity, graph quality, etc.

  • Ability to design and execute benchmarking experiments and evaluate model performance on domain-specific datasets. 

Benefits

  • Highly competitive total compensation packages  

  • Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

  • 401K with Company match

  • Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
JOIN AUGER — WHERE INNOVATION MEETS REAL-WORLD IMPACT

Imagine a place where you get the best of both worlds: the speed and energy of a startup, and the experience of leaders who’ve built systems that scale globally.

Founded by 23-year Amazon veteran and serial innovator Dave Clark and backed by a $100M investment led by Oak HC/FT, Auger isn’t just rethinking how global supply chains work—we’re redefining them.



WHAT WE’RE BUILDING

Auger is creating the world’s first agentic operating system for supply chains—turning one of the planet’s most complex systems into a source of foresight, resilience, and growth.

We partner with leading global enterprises to solve their toughest challenges: accelerating decision speed, reducing costs, unlocking capital, and improving service. With Auger, brittle fragments become an indestructible engine of progress, economic strength, and planetary sustainability.



WHY IT MATTERS

Supply chain problems aren’t just business problems—they’re human ones. When a supply chain breaks down, products don’t reach shelves, workers face burnout, and the environment pays the price. Auger is here to change that.

At Auger, you’ll join an expert team that’s fundamentally reshaping one of the world’s most vital industries. If you’re ready to build technology that makes a real impact on people, business, and the planet—come build with us.


ABOUT THE POSITION


Auger's AI & Semantic Intelligence Team is at the heart of this transformation—developing intelligent, context-aware systems that reason, learn, and act autonomously to improve global supply chains. We are seeking a curious and results-oriented Applied Scientist who is passionate about building the next generation of AI systems at scale. We have more ideas than time to implement, so the proven ability and passion to rapidly prototype and validate concepts is the most important skill for this role.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Design and scale semantic architectures that model complex relationships across massive, multi-modal data ecosystems.

 - Develop LLM-powered reasoning and retrieval pipelines, integrating RAG, semantic embeddings, and agentic decision-making capabilities.

 - Build and optimize vector-based search systems for high-dimensional semantic retrieval using ANN algorithms.

 - Lead research and experimentation on graph learning, representation learning, and large-scale NLP, with an emphasis on production-grade deployment.

 - Collaborate cross-functionally with data, ML, and engineering teams to ship intelligent systems that power Auger’s agentic platform.
   


WHAT YOU’LL BRING

1. Semantic Graph & Knowledge Graph Mastery

 - Deep experience designing and scaling semantic/knowledge graphs for complex domains.

 - Hands-on proficiency with Neo4j, ArangoDB, or Amazon Neptune and frameworks like DGL, PyTorch Geometric, or NetworkX.

 - Advanced skills in ontology design and entity disambiguation.

2. NLP, Generative AI & Embeddings

 - Mastery of NLP techniques for entity/relation extraction, summarization, and semantic understanding using transformer models (BERT, GPT, T5).

 - Expertise in embedding generation (Sentence-BERT, OpenAI embeddings, or domain-specific models).

 - Experience integrating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) or LLM orchestration into semantic pipelines.

3. Vector Databases & Scalable Search

 - Proficiency with Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus, or FAISS for vector search and retrieval.

 - Strong understanding of Approximate Nearest Neighbor (ANN) algorithms and real-time semantic indexing.

4. Advanced AI/ML for Semantic Systems

 - Experience with Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architectures, contrastive learning, and few/zero-shot learning.

 - Knowledge of multimodal AI—integrating text, images, and structured data into unified graph representations.

5. Research & Experimentation

 - Proven ability to conduct original research in NLP, semantic understanding, or graph learning (publications preferred).

 - Expertise in evaluation metrics for semantic systems: precision, recall, similarity, graph quality, etc.

 - Ability to design and execute benchmarking experiments and evaluate model performance on domain-specific datasets. 


BENEFITS

 - Highly competitive total compensation packages  

 - Top tier medical, dental, and vision insurance  and wellness perks

 - 401K with Company match

 - Work with teammates who tackle complex and consequential challenges with resilience, determination, and good humor.  

Auger considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
